alert.note: Alert for Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 30 at 9:27PM PST until December 02 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM FRIDAY TO 4 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to 3 inches. Winds gusting 20 to 35 mph Saturday. * WHERE...Entiat, Mansfield, Grand Coulee, Odessa, Creston, Cashmere, Pangborn Airport, Waterville, Wenatchee, Badger Mountain Road, Wilbur, Coulee City, Ritzville, Chelan, and Harrington. * WHEN...From 4 AM Friday to 4 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Wintry driving conditions. The conditions will impact the Friday morning and evening commutes. Patchy blowing snow is possible Saturday across portions of the Columbia Basin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow will occur into Friday morning, which will result in slick driving conditions. Snow intensity will likely increase Friday morning and through the evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area
